Course description: This graduate course explores the values, concepts, issues and responsibilities of individuals exercising leadership roles in pharmacy practice and health care settings. Health care, professional, industry, and regulatory factors that influence practice and medication use in organized settings will be discussed by representatives from various segments of the health care system.
*** Classes will be held in PHRM 3210 *** Instructor: Sam Louie, Email: sam.louie@shaw.ca, Tel: 604-980-0733
description: Institutional, professional and regulatory factors that influence the planning, implementation and control of pharmacy services in hospitals. Permission of instructor required.
